title: Acceleration due to gravity on the moon

content.question: The acceleration due to gravity on the Moon is <math alttext="g sub M" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>M</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>. Suppose an astronaut on the Moon drops an object from a height of <math alttext="H" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>H</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. The time it would take the object to reach the Moon’s surface would be <math alttext="T sub M" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>T</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>M</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>. The same object is dropped from the same height on Earth, where the acceleration due to gravity is <math alttext="g sub E" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>E</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>. The time it takes the object to reach Earth’s surface is <math alttext="T sub E" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>T</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>E</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>. Which of the following is a correct mathematical relationship for the two times?

choices.label: <math alttext="T sub E equals the square root of the fraction g sub E, over g sub M, end root, times T sub M" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>T</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>E</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><msqrt><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>E</mi></mrow></msub></mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>M</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msqrt><msub><mrow><mi>T</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>M</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="T sub E equals the square root of the fraction g sub M, over g sub E, end root, times T sub M" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>T</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>E</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><msqrt><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>M</mi></mrow></msub></mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>E</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msqrt><msub><mrow><mi>T</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>M</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="T sub E equals the fraction g sub E, over g sub M, end fraction, times T sub M" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>T</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>E</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>E</mi></mrow></msub></mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>M</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mfrac><msub><mrow><mi>T</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>M</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="T sub E equals the fraction g sub M, over g sub E, times T sub M" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>T</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>E</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>M</mi></mrow></msub></mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>E</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mfrac><msub><mrow><mi>T</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>M</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="T sub E equals T sub M" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>T</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>E</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi>T</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>M</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="T sub E equals the square root of the fraction g sub M, over g sub E, end root, times T sub M" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>T</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>E</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><msqrt><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>M</mi></mrow></msub></mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>E</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msqrt><msub><mrow><mi>T</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>M</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>
